subject: Nutrition
title: B12 The Vegan Dilemma
description: A micro-lesson that makes B12 The Vegan Dilemma usable.

hook.text: Vitamin B12 is found almost exclusively in animal foods. This creates a real problem for vegans.

buildup.text: B12 is essential for nerve function and red blood cell production. Deficiency causes irreversible damage.

discovery.text: The vitamin is made by bacteria in soil and animal gutsâ€”not by the animals or plants themselves.

twist.text: Our ancestors got B12 from unwashed produce and stream water. Modern sanitation removed those sources.

climax.text: Today, vegans rely on supplements or fortified foods. Even some meat-eaters are deficient due to poor absorption.

punchline.text: The cleanest diets may need the most supplements.

quiz.question: What organisms actually produce vitamin B12?
